triples.name: Reinforcement learning
triples.relevance: The foundational algorithmic approach that this survey reviews and applies to multiagent systems.

triples.name: Deep learning
triples.relevance: The key technique that enables deep RL algorithms to handle high-dimensional environments and unstructured data.

triples.name: Deep reinforcement learning
triples.relevance: The core subfield combining deep learning with RL, which is the main focus of this multiagent systems survey.

triples.name: Multi-agent system
triples.relevance: The central application domain where multiple agents must coordinate, communicate and cooperate to solve complex tasks.

triples.name: Multi-agent learning
triples.relevance: The subfield of machine learning that studies behavior of multiple learning agents in shared environments, the main topic of this survey.

triples.name: Sequential decision making
triples.relevance: The fundamental problem RL algorithms solve by making series of decisions over time to optimize cumulative rewards.

triples.name: Transfer learning
triples.relevance: A key approach reviewed in the survey for multiagent systems to reuse knowledge learned from one task in related tasks.

triples.name: Partially observable Markov decision process
triples.relevance: The mathematical framework for handling partial observability, a major challenge addressed in multiagent deep RL systems.
